title: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
content: Lately, I have been getting some unsolicited private messages on my new Telegram account, while I am not in any Telegram groups to warrant such users getting my account profile to send those PMs.The content of the message, as shown in the image below, reads, "Claim $10 USDT." I am fully aware it's from scammers. I received the first message from a different Telegram user, and the second message from a different person whose account got blocked before the end of the day he sent the message.Guys, please be warned; don't feel tempted to fall into the trap of these scammers, they are everywhere looking for victims. You never can tell; you might be clicking on a malware link and end up exposing your private information to scammers, and they can just steal your assets or have you on their watch list.Protect your self guys.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Are you sure you are not in any active telegram group that you are not aware of? Or maybe you have used the line to reg for telegram before, which you later wipe out, because it will be hell of a work for these scammers to go through and make some random username guesses just to send in some fake link to them. How I know this guys got their target audience is to visit a group or channel where you are either just a member or active in there, get the usernames of the members, and send them DMs bit by bit so they can be able to locate who was recently active and who was not, so I will advise you to run a back group check to see if you were on a channel before or not. Or maybe some Telegram username scrapper tool has been discovered, and usernames can be sold out to those who want to use it for marketing or scamming.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on December 15, 2023, 10:46:17 PMProtect your self guys. This isn't something new, telegram is a well known place for scammers.its easier for them to catch potential newbies over there on telegram. For me, I had to exist all external groups on my telegram and archived those that were less useful, so as to avoid receiving such scam messages. The best thing is to create a new telegram account with a new phone line and avoid joining telegram groups with unknown participants. Most of them are just scammers looking for fresh fish to fry. Let's all be careful.

comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: I have experienced such too but my was as a result of being a member of an active channel like CMC, Coingecko etc so my username got there attention and they direct messaged me with such tempting links. Personally I know that no company or some cryptocurrencies will Dm you to claim their rewards so obviously it would a scammers attempt. Mind you there are no permanent ways to stop receiving such Dm(s) you only have to be cautious on how you react to such information and never to hit the links.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Telegram is full of these scammers and even on whatsapp and other messaging apps where our numbers are associated with. They have a way to determine if the number or account is active and they'll just send a blast of messages to all of these numbers trying to get on a victim for the most contacts that they have.Bull run is approaching, more of these scams are coming and they might reinvent their strategies to just let people click on those scam/phishing links.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: Pretty much all the unsolicited messages are spam and scam, they are not worth even reading, and sometimes even opening them could get you hacked if there's a severe vulnerability in an app. Better configure the settings to disable messages from people who are not on your contact list. No one ever became rich by responding to money making offers lol.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: This is one of the most basic in terms of security dos and don'ts. I guess there are still some who fall to this uncreative fraud even if it only takes a little common sense on how to respond to it. If a stranger suddenly comes out of nowhere bringing gifts, that's a very obvious red flag. It should be discarded right away. You ask, what if it's true? What if there is indeed that freebie? Forget it, whether there's indeed that freebie or not, it isn't worth it. Taking a big risk for that worthless freebie? That's not logical. But what if the freebie is significant? Then it's an additional red flag; it's not something that should convince you to try it. There has to be a catch somewhere. If something significant is given freely, you're the product or the victim.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: You have to ask yourself: How do scammers know your telegram? Because you may end up getting attacked in a way that you didn't expect. Nowadays, scammers are very sophisticated in their methods of collecting user information. They collect everything together: information from social networks, information about your family, and other data that can be found about you on the Internet. And then, under the name of a friend or relative, they will be able to deceive you at a completely unexpected moment. Therefore, I would suggest checking all the connections that you show on the Internet and, if necessary, reducing them to a minimum.

comments.author: 2Pizza410000BTC
comments.body: OP, thank you for sharing such a message with us. When we log into our Telegram account, many times we can see different Telegram avatars giving such messages. There are many who are not very aware they believe such messages and fall prey to scams. But to date I have never entered a message that didn't lead to a scam. Because I was warned about such fraud long ago.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: Thank you for saying something about this but almost everyone is aware of this nowadays, it has become a normal thing in crypto space and I can't even count how many times I have gotten something similar to this, telegram is full of people who are ready to steal from any newbies who knows nothing, the lesson that everyone should learn here is to never give strangers any attention either Telegram or Twitter, these scammers are everywhere online today. There is also a new trick that is almost perfect and if you are not careful you might fall easily into the hands of these scammers, have you seen where by a telegram group of an official project got copied with the same exact followers in the fake one? And somehow they will add you, saying they are doing some airdrops? If I don't have anything against free offers and airdrops already I would have fall for the traps. If it's a must for you to use telegram make sure you adjust the security, change > who can add me to any group to > Nobody and you will be safe from these criminals, also adjust your PMs too as people can send you malicious links on telegram as well.

comments.author: kentrolla
comments.body: This has been happening for a very long time and I don't think most of us who are well versed with online scams will even bother opening these messages but some might wonder if you are not a part of any telegram group then how did these scammer even get through your DM. There are lot of ways which scammers can use and we have even seen some scammers checking the bounty spreadsheet for telegram username and imposture themselves as admin and share such links where people often fall for scam. We need to understand that no one pays $10 or even $1 for free. If something is free then you are the product.
